title: Alla barnen
text:
"Alla barnen" (<a href="Swedish%20language">Swedish</a> for "All the children") is a type of humorous poetic form, told primarily by schoolchildren in <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a>, although it originated in <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>. This <a href="meme">meme</a> was most popular in the early 1990s, as they were very macabre which at the time was highly unusual but their popularity has since diminished. The <a href="comic%20book">comic book</a> writing duo <a href="M%C3%A5ns%20Gahrton">Måns Gahrton</a> and <a href="Johan%20Unenge">Johan Unenge</a> has created several books based on the form, all with a title starting with "Alla barnen", the later ones in the series have discarded the more macabre jokes to be more child-friendly.
Form.
Compared to a <a href="limerick%20%28poetry%29">limerick</a> Alla Barnen is more free form with no set meter. They consist of three parts and these are:
And the name must <a href="rhyme">rhyme</a> with the end of the sentence.
